intro: Tabernaemontana markgrafiana, commonly known as the Markgrafiana crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pink. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves and produces fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
